|flash1type = NAND |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Spansion;S34ML01G100TFI00; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->

|eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Marvell;88E6172;M, 88E6172-TFJ2, PPN6210A.5JW, 1332 A1P, TW; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 94:10:3E, B4:75:0E |oui = 94:10:3E, B4:75:0E

|wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = <!-- Radio module name, optional link, Leave blank for none --> |rad2modif = Mini PCIe (dual) |rad2chip1 = Marvell;88W8864; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam2 = <!-- AC-qam --> |rad2ac = 1300 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Linksys WRT1900AC v1 - ''Mamba''
{{WiFiCert|WFA50538|12/12/2013}}
This device could possibly be somewhat (or ''really'') similar to '''Marvell''''s RD-88W-AP-8864-DR1 ref. design ([http://certifications.prod.wi-fi.org/pdf/certificate/public/download?cid=WFA51770 certified on 12/28]) notes each radio as using 3 spatial streams, OS as Linux 3.2.40.
===FCC info=== *"48SAM103.SGF" would appear to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. *"48.SAM102.SGC" and "2013.08.14" is silkscreened on the wireless module shown. ::The 802.11 <small>AS</small>ICs markings are not easily discernible. ::The 2.4GHz PAMs in use look to be SE2623Ls. ::The 5GHz PAMs in use seem to be SKY85402s. :The style of the module is similar to that of the [[:File:Actiontec_TwinTower-1A_802DRN_shield_off.jpg|TwinTower module]] used in the :[[Google Fiber Network Box (GFRG110)]] (also using a '''Marvell''' based board).
==Links of Interest== ===Wikis=== *{{WPLink|Linksys_routers#WRT1900AC}} *[https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt_ac_series On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] :[https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt_ac_series#wrt1900ac WRT1900AC v1] - [[Marvell]] MV78230 @1.2GHz (Mamba) :[https://wiki.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT1900AC WRT1900AC DD-WRT wiki]
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32393-linksys-wrt1900ac-ac1900-dual-band-wireless-router-review On '''SmallNetBuilder'''] ([http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32400-linksys-wrt1900ac-review-more-tests + more tests]) *[http://www.tweaktown.com/reviews/6248/linksys-wrt1900ac-802-11ac-smart-wireless-router-review/index2.html On '''TweakTown'''] *[https://openitforum.pl/index/recenzje/routery/linksys/wrt-1900ac/ On '''OpenITforum''']
===Forum / News aggregator posts=== *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=50173 ''Update on Linksys WRT1900AC support'' on the '''OpenWrt''' forums] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=256298 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] :references this [http://www.pcworld.com/article/2083993/linksys-announces-the-audacious-looking-wrt1900ac-dual-band-wi-fi-router.html '''PCWorld''' article] stating the device uses a '''Marvell''' chipset *[http://forums.smallnetbuilder.com/showthread.php?t=14580 On the '''SmallNetBuilder''' forums] *[http://www.reddit.com/r/linux/comments/2276er/belkin_begins_releasing_openwrt_code_for_the/ '''/r/linux''' thread on the first released '''OpenWrt''' patchset] *[http://community.linksys.com/t5/Wireless-Routers/WRT1900AC-Sudden-Disconnects/td-p/814076/page/21 ''Known Reboot issues''] *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?pid=230686 this post (''Update on Linksys WRT1900AC support'') on the '''OpenWrt''' forums]
===Reg. third party FW support=== *[https://github.com/wrt1900ac/opensource ''wrt1900ac/opensource'' repo on '''GitHub'''] *[https://lists.openwrt.org/pipermail/openwrt-devel/2014-April/024589.html '''Belkin''''s <small>first</small> patchset for the WRT1900AC submitted to the '''OpenWrt-Devel''' ML] :The wireless driver was submitted as a blob (''ap8x.ko'').. :the board (''Mamba'') is noted as using an MV78230 ('''ARMADA XP''') CPU and '''Renesas''' uPD720202 USB3 controller (an '''EtronTech''' controller is shown in the FCC photos).
While released without any real third-party firmware support, the WRT1900AC (and subsequent Marvell variants) are fairly well supported now that '''mwlwifi''' has been integrated into OpenWrt/LEDE, though inclusion into the mainline Linux kernel is still pending.
===Other=== *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W9D3RRG8HAQ Announcement video on '''YouTube'''] (1080p quality available) :The shown board seems to be manufactured by '''Wistron NeWeb''' ("48SAM103.SGB" / something like that appears to be silkscreened on it) :'''Linksys''''s previous '''Broadcom''' based gear manuf. by '''WNC''' had a board P/N starting with 48SAB, seeming to indicate that it is '''Marvell''' powered <small>('''MTK''' may still be '''R''')</small> :The Wi-Fi radios would ''appear'' to be modular (Mini PCIe) *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/other/ces-2014/32293-linksys-goes-back-to-the-future-for-new-ac1900-router ''Linksys Goes Back To The Future For New AC1900 Router'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] <!-- *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DYOAKK6-IvM ''PlayboiSwagga23'''s unboxing video on '''YouTube'''] :B4:75:0E OUI, 745883598601 UPC --> *[https://davidc502sis.dynamic-dns.net/ Davidc502 LEDE Snapshots for the MRVL WRT variants]
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = wrt1900ac build 27700 20150820 :[https://forum.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT1900AC Install Guide]
Please insert instructions here
